DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the cutoff point for IVC collapsibility index (by Bedside Ultrasonographic technique) for cases in hypovolemic hemorrhagic shock with CVP measures less than 8 cmH2o.
DOC.brief_title: The Cutoff Point for Caval Index and Its Correlation With Central Venous Pressure and Plasma Lactate Level for Assessing Patients in Hypovolemic Hemorrhagic States
DOC.criteria: Hypovolemic hemorrhagic subjects (class II or more)if they were more than 18 years old and CVC insertion was indicated for them. a history of Renal failure, Congestive Heart Failure, use of negative inotropic agents, presence of any contraindication for CVC insertion or failed ones and inability for measuring IVC by bUS were considered for exclusion.
